header: I aim to create services that people will remember for a long time
So I've been working consistently towards that goal

ObjectiveSection.title: Goals as a Developer
description: I started coding to solve the inconvenience I felt in school
I aim to create services that everyone can easily handle, making life more convenient

description: I have experience in development, design, publishing, and deployment.
Thanks to this, I can communicate seamlessly with professionals from other disciplines.

skills.name: Front-End
title: Prefer Smooth and Convenient
Screen Development
description: <0></0>I can request and load data at the appropriate time, apply various animation effects, and express them. I can efficiently develop using libraries, but I can also implement in pure JavaScript. After implementation, I continuously check if the features work as intended from the user's perspective.
<0>Technologies Used</0>TypeScript, React.js, Next.js, Redux Toolkit & Saga, React-Query, SWR

skills.name: Back-End
title: Can Create Secure Web Servers and
Databases
description: <0></0>I can build API servers for data requests and databases. I can create real-time data transmission functions using sockets. I can deploy stable websites using AWS and the Nginx proxy web server.
<0>Technologies Used</0>Node.js, Nest.js, Express.js, Prisma, Sequelize, Socket.io, Puppeteer, AWS EC2+S3+Lambda, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Python

skills.name: Design / Publishing
title: Pursue User-Centric Consistent
Interfaces
description: <0></0>Before starting development, I draw wireframes with design tools and proceed with publishing work. I can accurately and user-friendly responsive publishing, regardless of the order from large screens to small screens or vice versa.
<0>Technologies Used</0>TailwindCSS, Emotion, Framer-motion, Styled-Components, SCSS, Illustrator, PhotoShop, InDesign

skills.name: Skill Communication
title: Smooth Collaboration with Designers
description: I also double majored in visual design. Therefore, I have a lot of experience collaborating with designers. Having participated in projects from both the designer and developer positions, I can work without difficulty in communication.

SkillSection.projectsLinkLabel: Explore the projects I've worked on

questions.title: What are the advantages of working together?
questions.description: Having experienced various roles, I understand the roles of each position well. If you want backend work, I can communicate as a backend developer, and if you want publishing work, I can communicate as a publisher. I prioritize the environment that users look at most when creating a service, so I am confident that I will solve any issues perfectly in terms of feature development and screen publishing.

questions.title: What are the disadvantages of working together?
questions.description: During work, there are cases where the priority of tasks changes occasionally due to reviewing and resolving minor design issues or errors. As a perfectionist, I feel the need to resolve even small functional or design issues in situations where large-scale tasks need to be done. This aspect can be an advantage or a disadvantage depending on the partner's preference.

questions.title: Do you also design? What collaboration tools do you use with designers?
questions.description: Yes, I design myself. However, I invest more time in the development phase within a limited time frame, so I choose a design system and customize it for efficient progress. I prefer Figma as a collaboration tool, but I can use any tool that the designer prefers.

questions.title: Are there any ongoing or upcoming lectures?
questions.description: The last lecture I conducted was on data analysis and visualization two years ago. Unfortunately, at the moment, I am focused on the upcoming service launch and haven't had the opportunity to try more. However, around next year, when I have a bit more time, I will return with a fantastic service clone lecture!
